responsibilities: Develop and implement production software for preventing fraud
Work with external infrastructure teams to drive the development of infrastructure needs
Innovate by recognizing opportunities for automation and tools improvements
Develop and implement process improvements to bring efficiency and stability to fraud analytics
Provide technical leadership for a team of data scientists
Lead the team to increase the level of maturity and skill in analytical software development
qualifications: Mastery of one of Python, Java, Scala, C++ or equivalent language
Experience building data science or data analysis tools on Hadoop/cloud based systems
Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills
Solid grasp of computer science fundamentals including data structures and algorithms
Solid ability to evaluate and apply new technologies in a short time
analysis:
The job responsibilities focus on developing and implementing software for fraud prevention, system architecture design, infrastructure development, automation, process improvements, and providing technical leadership in data science. The skills required include proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, Scala, C++, experience with data science tools on Hadoop/cloud systems, problem-solving, and computer science fundamentals.

There is no explicit mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is more on fraud analytics, system architecture, and data science tools, which do not inherently imply the use of GenAI or LLMs. While data science can sometimes involve machine learning models, there is no specific indication that this role involves working with generative models or language models.

Therefore, based on the provided responsibilities and skills, it does not appear that this job involves working with Generative AI or language models.
